  <link>https://thesonarnetwork.com/evil-men</link><link rel="hub"  href="https://pubsubhubbub.appspot.com/" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" /><link rel="hub"  href="https://sonarnetwork.superfeedr.com/" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" /><link rel="self" href="https://thesonarnetwork.com/evil-men/feed/podcast" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" /><description>Evil Men is a podcast hosted by three comedians - Chris Locke, James Hartnett, and Michael Balazo.  Each episode, they select a single evil man, bad person, or fictional character and discuss what made them so damn evil - all while joking their heads off.  You’ll hear some super interesting nuggets of information about dubious historical or cultural figures, provided by three guys who don’t actually know what the hell they’re talking about.</description><itunes:summary>Evil Men is a podcast hosted by three comedians - Chris Locke, James Hartnett, and Michael Balazo.  Each episode, they select a single evil man, bad person, or fictional character and discuss what made them so damn evil - all while joking their heads off.  You’ll hear some super interesting nuggets of information about dubious historical or cultural figures, provided by three guys who don’t actually know what the hell they’re talking about.</itunes:summary><itunes:subtitle>Evil Men is a podcast where three comedians joke around about bad guys, rude dudes and sometimes … murderers!</itunes:subtitle><lastBuildDate>Thu, 07 Jul 2022 04:00:55 +0000</lastBuildDate><language>en-ca</language><sy:updatePeriod>weekly</sy:updatePeriod><sy:updateFrequency>1</sy:updateFrequency><itunes:explicit>yes</itunes:explicit><itunes:type>episodic</itunes:type><itunes:image href="https://thesonarnetwork.com/evil-men/wp-content/uploads/sites/45/2021/06/Evil-Men-logo-w-sonar-black-scaled.jpg" /><googleplay:image href="https://thesonarnetwork.com/evil-men/wp-content/uploads/sites/45/2021/06/Evil-Men-logo-w-sonar-black-scaled.jpg" /><image>

Ron Hubbard!</p>
<p>To some he was known as Hubby. To others, Hubbus. But whatever they called him, L. Ron Hubbard made history by transforming himself from a moderately successful sci-fi writer into the leader of his very own, very notorious religion. <span style="font-size: 16px">This week, </span><a style="font-size: 16px" href="https://twitter.com/chrislockeworld">Chris</a><span style="font-size: 16px">, </span><a style="font-size: 16px" href="https://twitter.com/jameshartnett">James</a><span style="font-size: 16px"> and </span><a style="font-size: 16px" href="https://twitter.com/mbalazo">Michael</a><span style="font-size: 16px"> finish their look at the improbable life and times of the man they called Hubin. Enjoy!</span></p>
<p>PLUS: James doesn&#8217;t believe in democracy! Politics! And baseball!</p>

Joe Team. But did you know that Cobra Commander started off as a used car salesman? That he was traumatized by the loss of his Vietnam vet brother? Or that he&#8217;s something of a fathers’ rights activist? <span style="font-size: 16px">This week, </span><a style="font-size: 16px" href="https://twitter.com/chrislockeworld">Chris</a><span style="font-size: 16px">, </span><a style="font-size: 16px" href="https://twitter.com/jameshartnett">James</a><span style="font-size: 16px"> and </span><a style="font-size: 16px" href="https://twitter.com/mbalazo">Michael</a><span style="font-size: 16px"> examine Cobra Commander&#8217;s life, evil plots and resemblance to William F. Buckley Jr. Enjoy!</span></p>
<p>PLUS: James swallows a furball! Chris has a family! And Michael listens to a podcast to drown out his late night thoughts!</p>

Joe Team. Soon after, he came to a violent, fiery end in a cabin northeast of Los Angeles. So, what drove this once friendly and upstanding guy to become a killer? <p>During <span style="font-size: 16px">Niyazov&#8217;s </span>reign, he ruined the economy, renamed the days of the week after his family members, banned dogs and cigarettes, and generally made life miserable for his subjects. He also tried to build an ice palace in the sweltering desert. <span style="font-size: 16px">This week, </span><a style="font-size: 16px" href="https://twitter.com/chrislockeworld">Chris</a><span style="font-size: 16px">, </span><a style="font-size: 16px" href="https://twitter.com/jameshartnett">James</a><span style="font-size: 16px"> and </span><a style="font-size: 16px" href="https://twitter.com/mbalazo">Michael</a><span style="font-size: 16px"> take a walk through the streets of old Ashgabat to learn about the self-proclaimed Great Leader of all Turkmen.</span></p>

His experiments with LSD ruined countless lives and achieved little of value. This week, </span><a style="font-size: 16px" href="https://twitter.com/chrislockeworld">Chris</a><span style="font-size: 16px">, </span><a style="font-size: 16px" href="https://twitter.com/jameshartnett">James</a><span style="font-size: 16px"> and </span><a style="font-size: 16px" href="https://twitter.com/mbalazo">Michael</a><span style="font-size: 16px"> look at Sidney Gottlieb&#8217;s life and decide if he was a Groovy Gus&#8230; or a Nasty Norman.</span></p>

He unified ancient China, oversaw the construction of the Great Wall and commissioned the Terracotta Army, hoping it would protect him in the afterlife. But he was also a brutal tyrant who burned books, enslaved his enemies and castrated anyone who made him angry. The guy LOVED castration!</p>

He even had a framed picture of Hitler in his bedroom, which didn’t exactly solve his social problems. When America entered WWII, Colepaugh did the unthinkable: he defected to Germany and volunteered to spy for the Nazis. Luckily, he was a bumbling fool who spent more time drinking in Manhattan nightclubs than undermining the Manhattan Project. This week, <a href="https://twitter.com/chrislockeworld">Chris</a>, <a href="https://twitter.com/jameshartnett">James</a> and <a href="https://twitter.com/mbalazo">Michael</a> make fun of the Nazis and totally disrespect the Third Reich.</p>

We kick things off by talking about: mad cow disease, frozen cigarettes, jail guys and the allure of dirtballs.</p>
<p>Our subject this week is American philanthropist, bird-lover, wrestling enthusiast and convicted murderer John du Pont. Born into one of America’s wealthiest and most prestigious families, John could have done anything. But a lonely childhood, a balls tragedy(?) and his failure to achieve athletic greatness chipped away at his sanity. Eventually, an unhinged John murdered Dave Schultz, a world champion wrestler who worked for him. Why? It’s unclear. Enjoy!</p>

Serving as Chief Justice during the Salem Witch Trials (1692-1693), Stoughton was a stern and extremely pious man who truly believed he was sent by God to chase the Devil out of Massachusetts Bay. Unfortunately, his righteous war on witchcraft involved arresting four-year-olds, terrorizing elderly, deaf women, and sentencing twenty innocent people to death based on &#8220;spectral evidence.&#8221; Enjoy!</p>

As the impresario behind the Backstreet Boys, NSYNC and the inimitable O-Town, he lived a gilded, glamorous life that was a world away from his modest upbringing in Queens. Unfortunately, he was also a conman who perpetrated the biggest Ponzi scheme in American history. And his behavior around fame-hungry teenage boys was… questionable. Lou Pearlman was a complicated man. But most of all, he was Art Garfunkel’s cousin. Enjoy!</p>

Soon, he rose to become one of television’s most popular conservative opinion makers, exercising enormous influence over American culture and politics. Then it all blew up in his face, he lost his TV show for being a creep, and he was forced to become friends with Dennis Miller. This week, Evil Men examines the pissed off life of Bill O’Reilly. Enjoy!</p>
<p>PLUS: <a href="https://twitter.com/chrislockeworld">Chris</a>, <a href="https://twitter.com/jameshartnett">James</a> and <a href="https://twitter.com/mbalazo">Michael</a> discuss the Pope, the Beatles, Kim and Kanye and MORE!</p>

Each episode, they select an evil man, bad person, or fictional character and discuss what made them so damn evil—all while joking their heads off and not being too serious.</p>
<p>For the inaugural episode, the guys explore one of the most notorious evil men in history: Jeffrey Dahmer. They dig into Jeff’s life as a serial killer, plus they explore his little known ties to the worlds of practical jokes, tennis and the chocolate industry.</p>
<p><a href="https://www.patreon.com/evilmen">Support Evil Men on Patreon</a> for exclusive monthly bonus episodes!</p>
